titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Joseph L. Frost, Indictment
CWG7495

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Fayette CIRCUIT COURT.
The Commonwealth of Kentucky,
AGAINST
Joseph L Frost

THE GRAND JURY of Fayette county, in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, accuse Joseph L Frost of the Crime of Horse Stealing committed as follows, viz: The said Joseph L Frost on the 1st day of September 18625 in the county aforesaid, Feloniously took and carried away one Sorrel Mare the personal property of T E Baly against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, and the Grand Jurors aforesaid in the name and by the authority aforesaid accuse the said Joseph L Frost "of the Crime of receiving stolen property knowing that the same was stolen" committed as follows, towit, the said Joseph L Frost on the day aforesaid, in the County aforesaid did receive on Sorrel Mare, the personal property of T E Baly knowing at the time that she was stolen against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.

WITNESSES: T E Baly,
E Foley
a true Copy -- Att Jno B Norton c f c c

Comth Kentucky
vs. } Copy Indict
Frost Jos L

A true Bill.
R J Spurr, Foreman
at Jno B Norton c f c c
